subject: Haptic Reactors mount
description_text:
Hello,

I have a question regarding the orientation of the haptic reactors of the
brake and throttle.

I've seen other systems that have the reactor as you have the clutch. Is
there a reason for your option on having on in a different orientation for
the brake and throttle?  Can it be mount as the clutch? If so, does your
system already have this option (the mounting piece allows both
orientations)?

Thanks.

Best regards,
João Oliveira

conversations.body_text: Hi Joao Oliveira,    During the design phase, we initially intended for the throttle, brake, and clutch to share the same mounting orientation. However, due to structural interference at the clutch position, the clutch had to be mounted on the side. If all three haptic motors were mounted in the same orientation as the clutch, it could lead to accidental missteps when switching between pedals or result in excessive horizontal spacing. This may also affect the stability of some pedal mounts or cause insufficient mounting width.  If you believe that most users would prefer the clutch-style mounting orientation, please let us know. We will conduct tests and evaluations based on user feedback.

Good morning,

Thanks for replying. From what I read, the way that Haptic shake, it's more
efficient if you mount them perpendicular to the pedal.

From what you describe, it seems more like a limitation on terms of space
rather an option for user experience.

In this post on Reddit, there are already people mounting the haptic
reactors this way and giving a good feedback:
https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1lvaf22/ive_made_mounts_for_simsonns_new_vam_pro_haptic/

Best of all was giving option to the user to be able the mount the haptics
in both ways with a second mounting piece or an universal one.

Would be great if you consider this solution and offer the clients both
options.

Hope that I contributed to improve your pedals.

Best regards,
João Oliveira

A quarta, 10/09/2025, 00:49, support@simsonn.com

Hi Joao Oliveira,  Alright, we will have our engineers download this model and test for any interference issues. If we find a better solution, we will make improvements to this bracket. Thank you very much for your valuable feedback!
